newsitem.title: GERMANY: German DGB vows strikes to defend wage agreements.
newsitem.headline: German DGB vows strikes to defend wage agreements.

text.p: German unions plan to defend existing wage agreements with strikes if necessary, the German Trade Union Federation DGB said on Wednesday.
Ursula Engelen-Kefer, deputy head of the DGB, warned the group would not shy away from industrial action if employers planned to use negotiations merely as a forum to issue edicts.
"If employers expect us to accept their gunboat diplomacy, then they are very wrong," she said.
She also said the group was still protesting against the Kohl government's planned savings package, announcing more demonstrations to protest against the plan at the weekend in six German cities.
Most recently construction industry employers cancelled two contracts for east German workers which would have raised their salaries by 1.85 percent from September 1.
